meanings.definition: A person who pretends to be important or knowledgeable but is actually untrustworthy or insignificant.
meanings.sent1: The tinhorns at the party boasted about their fake achievements.
meanings.sent2: Don't trust those tinhorns with their fancy suits and empty words.
meanings.sent3: The tinhorns tried to impress everyone with their made-up stories.
meanings.sent4: The city was full of tinhorns, each claiming to be the next big thing.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the tinhorns who talk big but deliver nothing.

meanings.definition: A cheap, flashy, or insincere person.
meanings.sent1: She saw through his act and realized he was just a tinhorns.
meanings.sent2: The tinhorns in the club were all show and no substance.
meanings.sent3: The tinhorns tried to impress with their fake designer clothes.
meanings.sent4: The city was full of tinhorns, each trying to outshine the other.
meanings.sent5: The tinhorns' flashy jewelry couldn't hide their true nature.

meanings.sent1: The tinhorns at the card table were quickly losing their money.
meanings.sent2: The town was full of tinhorns looking to make a quick buck.
meanings.sent3: The tinhorns thought they could outsmart the casino, but they were wrong.
meanings.sent4: The tinhorns played their games, hoping for easy wins.
meanings.sent5: The tinhorns' schemes always ended in disappointment.
